result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Bryan Isaacson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES. Court give credit for 0 days served. Court is opposed to electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all mandatory coourt costs, fees, surcharges and assessment, during first 24 months of probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive. Cash bail to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Defendant to make regular payments. Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular payments.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers. Defendant shall be tested at a minimum, twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.
AODA assessment and INTENSIVE drug treatment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 30 days for the first violation, 90 days for the second violation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Bryan Isaacson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: -Scanned; ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Donald Bryan Isaacson in court with attorney Erik B Ellingson.  Defendant Donald Bryan Isaacson in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements given by the state, defense, and the defendant.   

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 0 days served.  Court is opposed to electronic monitoring.

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 30 MONTHS with the following conditions:

- 120 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 30 days for the first violation, 90 days for the second violation.
- AODA assessment and INTENSIVE drug treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested at a minimum, twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, during first 24 months of probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Attorney Erik Brian Ellingson in court, defendant Donald Bryan Isaacson not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/29/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donald Bryan Isaacson in court with Attorney Joseph Domask, appearing for Attorney Erik Brian Ellingson.  Defendant Donald Bryan Isaacson in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty. Court orders case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 3.
